intro: Dovea racemosa, commonly known as the racemose dovea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dovea racemosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
